nodes.bodyText: Do we need the temp variable?
I have used a way to auto generate the converter. So this is the common format. It does not cause great pain for sdk. I would suggest not tune one by one.

Logger is not used in this class. Remove this here and in other converters where it's not used.

nodes.bodyText: I have strong concerns about how maintainable this will be if there is API changes in this area.

For any swagger rename, add or delete field properties changes. The code won't compile. Then we need to make a change to the Converter layer.
It needs some work compared to previous approach if no change needs to apply.
This has been resolved from offline discussion and will continue with this approach in the short term until the long term approach to support such transformations in autorest itself is available.

Given that CharFilter can't be final won't this blow up if a customer makes their own extension with additional metadata they want to maintain? I don't think it is likely but this change makes this a possible issue.
Does it make sense to use two different enums? This can be shared between the custom and implementation layer.
I will try to remove and test. It seems not all can be easily pop up.

Follow up on issue: #11386
Will optimize converter layers.
This is an enum value, this can be shared between custom and implementation.
Does this class have no properties? Does it really need to have a custom and implementation type?
As the other case where we are checking instanceof, I have concern about maintainability.
These are going to get values right? I see them being used in log statements.

nodes.bodyText: All these converters should have private ctor.
Why are all these constants empty strings?
Forget to fill in the messages.
I thought we wanted to call this ComplexSearchField.
I do not have a clear memory on this. @heaths what's the name in .NET?
Confirmed with Heath, we will go with ComplexField, same applies to SimpleField, SearchableField
Again, concerned about the maintainability of this.
Given that this is an enum does it really need a custom and implementation representation?
Should we check Field.isAccessible before needing to call into privileged code?

This is a tradeoff.
I don't know if we want to block customer to reflect on the return model if they turn on the SecurityManager. The code here is to avoid failure on reflection when customer has SecuirityManager on their machines.
Oh, I mean check if the field is already accessible before making the privileged call.
Agree with Alan - do this only when required instead of always doing this as this has performance implications.
nit: remove extra newline in all these converters.
Why is the exception message used to determine if it's a 404 error? You can check if the status code in the response is 404 instead. exception.getResponse().getStatusCode() == 404.
You are right. I will check the status code.
